name: Acadia National Park

name: Dry Tortugas National Park

name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
description: Great Smoky Mountains National Park is an American national park in the southeastern United States, with parts in North Carolina and Tennessee. description: Guadalupe Mountains National Park is an American national park in the Guadalupe Mountains, east of El Paso, Texas. name: Haleakalā National Park
description: Haleakalā National Park is an American national park located on the island of Maui in the state of Hawaii. name: Indiana Dunes National Park

name: Isle Royale National Park

name: Joshua Tree National Park

name: Katmai National Park
description: Katmai National Park and Preserve is an American national park and preserve in southwest Alaska, notable for the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes and for its brown bears.  The park and preserve encompass 4,093,077 acres (6,395.43 sq mi; 16,564.09 km2), which is between the sizes of Connecticut and New Jersey.

name: Kenai Fjords National Park

name: Kings Canyon National Park
description: Kings Canyon National Park is an American national park in the southern Sierra Nevada, in Fresno and Tulare Counties, California.  Originally established in 1890 as General Grant National Park, the park was greatly expanded and renamed to Kings Canyon National Park on March 4, 1940.

name: Kobuk Valley National Park
description: Kobuk Valley National Park is an American national park in the Arctic region of northwestern Alaska, located about 25 miles (40 km) north of the Arctic Circle. name: Lake Clark National Park

name: Fort Frederica National Monument

name: Fort Matanzas National Monument

name: Fort Monroe National Monument

Along with Fort Wool, Fort Monroe originally guarded the navigation channel between the Chesapeake Bay and Hampton Roads—the natural roadstead at the confluence of the Elizabeth, the Nansemond and the James rivers.

name: Fort Pulaski National Monument
description: Fort Pulaski National Monument is located on Cockspur Island between Savannah and Tybee Island, Georgia.  It preserves Fort Pulaski, the place where the Union Army successfully tested rifled cannon in combat during the American Civil War in 1862, the success of which rendered brick fortifications obsolete.

name: Fort Stanwix National Monument

name: Fort Union National Monument

name: Fossil Butte National Monument

name: Freedom Riders National Monument
description: The Freedom Riders National Monument is a United States National Monument in Anniston, Alabama established by President Barack Obama in January 2017 to preserve and commemorate the Freedom Riders during the Civil Rights Movement. name: George Washington Birthplace National Monument
